pros: Helping people progress in their relationship with Christ. Teaching, leading and influencing.
cons: Long hours and working with some difficult people.

pros: My local church is in a position of health and peace with a relatively good reputation in the community.
cons: My denomination is having a hard time wrestling with societal changes without becoming defensive and recalcitrant

review_title: A great ministry to work for!
pros: Great people, great environment, caring company.
cons: I can’t think of any.

pros: Great Support both spiritually and financially
cons: Like any organization politics are at play

job_title: Next Generation Ministries Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The National Office of the C&MA is full of well meaning and good hearted people. It is a family like work environment. They have a strong missions value and in many ways it resembles a mission trip agency more than a church denomination. They are starting to transition into hiring staff based off of skill. They have an awesome donor relations team and development team that do great work with graphics and media.
cons: They are very inbred so there are a lot of pastors and international workers that end up at the National Office. They are very inefficient in their structure organizationally. Project management and event management are particularly disorganized and poorly done. There aren't any raises or bonuses or ways to advance in your career unless someone leaves or gets fired. They are very old fashion in their policies and procedures which makes them feel 5-10 years behind the curve compared to other non-profits.

pros: I love the mission and the way that they care for their people.
cons: We aren't in it for the pay ;)

pros: Employees care both about the mission and one another.
cons: Salary isn't fantastic, opportunities for growth are limited.

review_title: Great Church Denomination to work for.
pros: Leadership, Beliefs, Alows churches to remain independent.
cons: Lack of support sometimes. Ministry is tough.

review_title: Love the organization and the people
pros:
Strong biblical foundation esp in addressing today's cultural challenges
DNA is all about Jesus Christ
Entrepreneurial toward missions
Church planting is a priority
A Best place to work in terms of leadership style, empowering, and mission focus
cons: greatest strength of empowering and risk taking can sometimes be offset with some pastoral leaders drifting from our major focus of the Great Commission Fund- and doing their own homemade brew of missions

pros: We work towards the same goal most of the time. Everyone tries to get along with each other. Small staff.
cons: It helps to be related to someone or have a long long history with a church, even if you are not the best person for a job, you may get hired.

review_title: A place one person can make a difference
pros: It's a family-orientated atmosphere.  On the mission field it's a very tight-knit group that often does a good job of supporting each other.  Country-to-country there's a lot of variance in team culture but often an employee can have a large say in what their role is.
cons: Lots of nepotism.  Lots of people on the mission field and at national office are related and those people certainly get more perks and favoritism.

pros: Some really good people to work with that are committed to seeing the world be changed for the better.
cons: Can be a bit insiderish. If you have not been in the group for a long time you may feel a bit like an outsider. Must know how to follow the insider rules.

pros: Opportunity to live in different cultures and make a meaningful spiritual impact. I've met life-long friends and have great memories. The inter-staff connections in our group were excellent.
cons: The monthly stipend was too small, especially as families grew.  The pension system collapsed and very little was done for those who'd paid into it for years, only to have basically only the principal with no interest (the pension system was obligatory).

pros: The C&MA is a great organization to be associated with. Very supportive and encouraging like being part of a large family. Leadership demonstrates what appears to be genuine humility and desire to serve those they lead.
cons: Like most families, the C&MA has a wide variety of personalities which occasionally conflict. Some cliquish behavior in places.

pros: Great vision, great leader.  This movement demonstrates high integrity in every area and is one of the least wasteful, on-the-move denominations in the world
cons: Sometimes the desire to be good stewards outpaces their desire to be generous.  Sometimes the desire to extend grace to people in a conflict results in inaction.  Sometimes people get entrenched in roles that do not suit them well.

pros:
Authentic people who care about you as a person.
Encouragement to learn and grow in your position.
Weekly Chapels, Prayer Times, and Breaks encourage strong interpersonal relationships.
Empowering to do your job well.
Humble leadership.
Amazing office Chaplains are available to walk with employees through difficulties.
Time off is generous.
cons:
Not a lot of opportunity for promotions.
Finances are tight so salary increases are rare.

pros: This is an organizations that knows the direction they are going, and stick to it.  They are honest and operate with integrity.  They treat their people with kindness and respect.
cons: It is difficult to find open positions at times.

job_title: International Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Global focus; never micro-manages; trusts employees more significantly than any other company I've worked for.
cons: Always operates on a tight budget, but makes the most of it.

pros: Understanding leadership, talented teammates, spiritual atmosphere.
cons: Little room for promotion, slow-moving, lower pay scale than comparable organizations.

pros: Global Organization, Global reach, Global Mission
cons: Classical thinking, Low risk taking, lack strategic thinking

pros: supportive management, helpful co-workers, fair pay
cons: There were no downsides to working here
